name: John Doez
other_medications: None. ART-naive when started on TLD.

visits.clinician_note:
Complaints & Symptoms:
52-year-old man presents with 3-week history of generalized weakness and decreased appetite. Also notes his urine appears 'foamy' recently.

Examination Findings:
BP 148/92 mmHg. Weight 78kg (was 82kg 6 months ago). Mild bilateral pedal oedema. No ascites. Fundoscopy: mild hypertensive changes, no diabetic retinopathy.

Prior History:
HIV diagnosed 2020. Type 2 diabetes mellitus diagnosed 2019, on metformin 1g BD and glibenclamide 5mg BD. Hypertension diagnosed 2021, on amlodipine 10mg OD and lisinopril 10mg OD. Completed TB treatment (2RHZE/4RH) in 2022. Takes co-trimoxazole 960mg OD for prophylaxis. Recent course of gentamicin IM for presumed UTI 6 weeks ago (given at local clinic).

labs_narrative.narrative_text: Creatinine: 2.8 mg/dL (was 1.3 mg/dL 3 months ago, 1.0 mg/dL 1 year ago). eGFR: 24 mL/min/1.73m2. Urinalysis: Protein 3+, glucose 2+. HbA1c: 8.2%. Fasting glucose: 186 mg/dL. Potassium: 5.4 mEq/L. Phosphate: 2.1 mg/dL (low). Viral load: <50 copies/mL. CD4: 445 cells/uL.

intake.complaints_symptoms: 52-year-old man presents with 3-week history of generalized weakness and decreased appetite. Also notes his urine appears 'foamy' recently.
intake.examination_findings: BP 148/92 mmHg. Weight 78kg (was 82kg 6 months ago). Mild bilateral pedal oedema. No ascites. Fundoscopy: mild hypertensive changes, no diabetic retinopathy.

Hypertension diagnosed 2021, on amlodipine 10mg OD and lisinopril 10mg OD. Completed TB treatment (2RHZE/4RH) in 2022. Takes co-trimoxazole 960mg OD for prophylaxis. Recent course of gentamicin IM for presumed UTI 6 weeks ago (given at local clinic).

visits.clinician_note:
Complaints & Symptoms:
29-year-old woman presents for routine 3-month follow-up after initiating ART. No complaints. Feeling well, energy improved since starting treatment.

Examination Findings:
BP 110/70 mmHg. Weight 68kg (pre-pregnancy weight 62kg). Fundal height appropriate for dates. Fetal movements present. No oedema. Urine dipstick negative for protein.

Significant history prior to today's visit:
HIV diagnosed 10 weeks ago during antenatal screening. Currently 22 weeks pregnant (second pregnancy, first child alive and well). No other medical conditions. No regular medications prior to ART. Taking ferrous sulfate and folic acid as prescribed.

labs_narrative.narrative_text: Creatinine: 1.1 mg/dL (baseline before ART: 0.8 mg/dL). eGFR: 78 mL/min/1.73m2. Urinalysis: Normal, no protein, no glucose. Viral load: 89 copies/mL (down from 125,000 at diagnosis). CD4: 389 cells/uL (was 312 at diagnosis). Hb: 10.8 g/dL. Phosphate: 3.8 mg/dL (normal).

intake.complaints_symptoms: 29-year-old woman presents for routine 3-month follow-up after initiating ART. No complaints. Feeling well, energy improved since starting treatment.
intake.examination_findings: BP 110/70 mmHg. Weight 68kg (pre-pregnancy weight 62kg). Fundal height appropriate for dates. Fetal movements present. No oedema. Urine dipstick negative for protein.
intake.prior_history: HIV diagnosed 10 weeks ago during antenatal screening. Currently 22 weeks pregnant (second pregnancy, first child alive and well). No other medical conditions. No regular medications prior to ART. Taking ferrous sulfate and folic acid as prescribed.
